64975.title: dress
64975.description:
Red wool knit dress trimmed with purple knit wool binding.
 It has a deep fitted bust with deep décolletage and semi-full long skirt.
64975.provenance: (Beverley Birks), New York, New York; acquired by the Indianapolis Museum of Art May 2008.
64975.inscription: Label: Rudi Gernreich for Harmon Knitwear
64975.dimensions:
L: 47-1/2 in. (back)
L: 45-1/4 in. (front)
W: 11-11/16 in. (shoulders)

65028.title: jumpsuit
65028.description: black trompe l'oeil polyester knit swimsuit on white matte ployester jersey
65028.credit_line: Mr. and Mrs. William B. Ansted, Jr. Art Fund
65028.provenance: (Doris Raymond, Los Angeles, California); acquired by IMA May 2008.
65028.inscription: Label: Rudi Gernreich design for Harmon Knitwear
65028.dimensions:
L: 28 1/4 (front neck to hem)
L: 31 1/4 in. (back neck to hem)
W: 11 15/16 in. (shoulders)

82362.title: eMate 300 computer with stylus
82362.description: personal digital computer designed, manufactured, and sold by Apple to the education market as a low-cost laptop running the Newton operating system introduced March 7, 1997 and discontinued February 27, 1998, 25 MHz ARM 710a RISC processor, translucent durable case, 480 x 320 resolution 16 shade gray scale display with backlight, a stylus pen, a full sized keyboard, an infared port, and standard Macintosh serial/LocalTalk ports, built-in rechargeable batteries.
82362.credit_line: Gift of Jonathan and Louisa Zufi
82362.provenance: Jonathan and Louisa Zufi, Atlanta, Georgia; given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 2013.
82362.dimensions:
A) computer: 7-1/2 x 12 x 11-1/2 in. (open)
2 x 12 x 11-1/2 in. (closed)
B) stylus: 5 x 1/4 (diam.) in.

86231.title: CIGARETTE BOX
86231.credit_line: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Robert H. Morse, Jr.

2647.title: Tile
2647.description: Group of five square or round encaustic tiles with conventional leaf-like unit repeated four times abut a 6 inch diameter center and inlaid.  In this group of five tiles, some have two colors and some have three colors of cream clay and gray blue or light red.  One has red and gray with black and white center.  Four are marked "United States Encaustic Tile Works, Indpls."
2647.credit_line: Gift of United States Encaustic Tile Works
2647.provenance: United States Encaustic Tile Works, Indianapolis, Indiana

69180.title: pair of urns
69180.description: Pair of blue blown glass urns of campana form with applied handles. Square base.
69180.provenance: Allen Whitehill Clowes, Indianapolis, Indiana; given to the Indianapolis Museum of Art in 2010.

67080.title: dress
67080.description: burgundy polyester dress with violet satin trim, the satin trim is affixed in a line down the center front and covers the back of two ribbons that tie in the back. The dress has several small buttons closing the sleeves at the wrist and tracing along the spine.
67080.credit_line: Gift of Gayle R. Atkins in memory of her mother, Elizabeth H. Rogers
67080.provenance: Mrs. Charles Eugene Rogers (previously Elizabeth Jane Heiskell), Indianapolis; Gayle R. Atkins (daughter), Indianapolis; IMA, 10-13-2008.
67080.dimensions:
L: 42 in. (back to hem)
W: 19 in. (shoulder)
